intro: Ludwigia albiflora, commonly known as whiteflower Ludwigia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its striking white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in wetland environments, such as marshes and along the edges of ponds. Its leaves are usually opposite and oval-shaped, while its stems are often reddish in color. Ludwigia albiflora is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in water gardens and ponds due to its aesthetic appeal.
